publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5300 Karen Whitefield: Cancer Poverty—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Macmillan Cancer Support’s "Hitting Home" campaign on 13 December 2006; recognises that cancer-related poverty is causing ill people to lose their homes; welcomes the services that Macmillan provides to support people who face financial difficulties after being diagnosed with cancer, and supports moves to end cancer poverty. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*, Tricia Marwick*, Stewart Stevenson*, Margaret Jamieson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Murray Tosh*, Richard Lochhead*, Marlyn Glen*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Scott Barrie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*, Bill Butler*, Jackie Baillie*, Sarah Boyack*, Trish Godman*

S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Mr David Davidson*, Shiona Baird*, Nora Radcliffe*, Eleanor Scott*, Tommy Sheridan*, John Swinburne*, Rosie Kane*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Colin Fox*, Michael Matheson*, Cathie Craigie*

S2M-5300 Karen Whitefield: Cancer Poverty—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Macmillan Cancer Support’s "Hitting Home" campaign on 13 December 2006; recognises that cancer-related poverty is causing ill people to lose their homes; welcomes the services that Macmillan provides to support people who face financial difficulties after being diagnosed with cancer, and supports moves to end cancer poverty. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Tricia Marwick, Stewart Stevenson, Margaret Jamieson, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Murray Tosh, Richard Lochhead, Marlyn Glen, Marilyn Livingstone, Scott Barrie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Michael McMahon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Brian Adam, Bruce Crawford, Bill Butler, Jackie Baillie, Sarah Boyack, Trish Godman, Mr David Davidson, Shiona Baird, Nora Radcliffe, Eleanor Scott, Tommy Sheridan, John Swinburne, Rosie Kane, Dr Elaine Murray, Colin Fox, Michael Matheson, Cathie Craigie
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Kate Maclean*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Frances Curran*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Karen Gillon*, John Home Robertson*
S2M-5300 Cancer Poverty (lodged on 11 December 2006) Cathy Peattie*

S2M-5300 Karen Whitefield: Cancer Poverty—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Macmillan Cancer Support’s "Hitting Home" campaign on 13 December 2006; recognises that cancer-related poverty is causing ill people to lose their homes; welcomes the services that Macmillan provides to support people who face financial difficulties after being diagnosed with cancer, and supports moves to end cancer poverty. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Tricia Marwick, Stewart Stevenson, Margaret Jamieson, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Murray Tosh, Richard Lochhead, Marlyn Glen, Marilyn Livingstone, Scott Barrie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Michael McMahon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Brian Adam, Bruce Crawford, Bill Butler, Jackie Baillie, Sarah Boyack, Trish Godman, Mr David Davidson, Shiona Baird, Nora Radcliffe, Eleanor Scott, Tommy Sheridan, John Swinburne, Rosie Kane, Dr Elaine Murray, Colin Fox, Michael Matheson, Cathie Craigie, Mr Adam Ingram, Maureen Macmillan, Dr Jean Turner, Kate Maclean, Frances Curran, Karen Gillon, John Home Robertson, Cathy Peattie
